instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no sound by speaker.
threads.message:
Got this one. It was badly damaged by water. Repaired main lines now everything is working fine except sound. 

Things that already tried: 

<CHIP>U6400</CHIP> reballed and after replaced
new sound board  from working macbook air and not working too, (flex also had been changed). 


I dont know what can i check now?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no sound by speaker.
threads.message:
Is the audio codec recognized in System Report?
Possibly corroded traces, small coils, or resistors.
Headphones not working too?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no sound by speaker.
threads.message: headphone is working and audio codec is recognized ( up and down volume normally and sound bar is working but no sound from speakers)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no sound by speaker.
threads.message:
Volume bar available on speakers only?
In such case, try other speakers.
You can check speakers continuity directly on the MLB connector; 4-8 ohms usually.
